equipment: Silicone baking mat or parchment paper

failure: wrong temperature scale used (F vs C)

instructions.original_text: Add the cottage cheese to a blender and blend until smooth and there are no large chunks of cheese.

output_quality: No large curds or chunks remain; texture is smooth and pourable

instructions.original_text: Add the flour, salt, and baking soda to a medium bowl and whisk. You can also put those ingredients in a sifter and sift them if you like instead.

task.action_name: Combine dry ingredients in a bowl and whisk (or sift).
output_quality: Flour, salt and baking soda are evenly combined and aerated

failure: uneven distribution of salt or leavening

instructions.original_text: Add the softened butter, brown sugar, and white granulated sugar to a large bowl and mix with a spoon or an electric mixer. Then add the vanilla extract and egg and mix until combined.

output_quality: Mixture is smooth, slightly fluffy, sugars incorporated

task.action_name: Add vanilla and egg and mix until combined.
output_quality: Homogeneous wet mixture with no visible separate egg whites or yolk

instructions.original_text: Next, add the blended cottage cheese and mix until combined.

task.action_name: Fold blended cottage cheese into wet mixture.
output_quality: Mixture is uniform and slightly creamy from cottage cheese

failure: large pockets of cottage cheese remain

instructions.original_text: Add the chocolate chips and stir those in then add the flour mixture a little at a time until all combined and you are left with the cookie dough.

output_quality: Chocolate chips distributed evenly throughout the wet mixture

task.action_name: Add dry ingredients gradually and mix until combined.
output_quality: Dough formed, no visible streaks of flour, slightly soft but scoopable

instructions.original_text: Use a cookie scoop or two spoons and place cookie dough on a sheet pan lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. You should be able to get 12 of them on there. Space them about 2 inches apart.

task.action_name: Portion cookie dough onto prepared sheet pan.
output_quality: Approximately 12 scoops per pan, dough mounds spaced about 2 inches apart

failure: dough mounds too close causing cookies to merge

instructions.original_text: Bake at 350F/176C for 10 to 14 minutes until lightly golden brown.

output_quality: Edges are lightly golden brown; centers set but still soft

instructions.original_text: Allow the cookies to cool on the pan for 2 to 3 minutes then transfer to a wire cookie rack to cool completely.

task.action_name: Cool cookies on pan for 2–3 minutes.
output_quality: Cookies firm enough to transfer without falling apart

task.action_name: Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool completely.

failure: cookies remain warm and soggy if not cooled

instructions.original_text: Enjoy! This recipe will make around 24 total cookies.

output_quality: Approximately 24 cookies total (two pans of 12 each)
Cookies stored in an airtight container remain fresh
